article.para: In order to improve the chance of continued funding for the FlyMine project it would be really appreciated if anyone that uses FlyMine or parts of FlyMine would let us know. Just drop a quick email to info[at]flymine.org.
Depending on your needs, you can either download precompiled jar files of the FlyMine distribution, or build these yourself from source.

sect1.title: Obtaining the source code
sect1.para: The source code can be obtained via a download, or via anonymous CVS.

sect2.title: Downloading the source code
sect2.para: The source code can be downloaded as either an official release, or a nightly build. The source code is available in tar.gz or ZIP format.
Official releases - this is where the official FlyMine release appear. Official releases are planned to occur every couple of months, on average.
Nightly build - this is a snapshot of the FlyMine source code taken last night. This will work, but may be in a state of flux, and with portions undocumented, or not conforming to the documentation.

sect1.title: Building FlyMine from the source code
sect1.para: The only prerequisite for building FlyMine is Ant. This should be downloaded and installed on your machine.
Depending on your requirements there are a choice of targets that you can build.

sect2.title: Building a FlyMine client
sect2.para: A FlyMine client is simply a program that accesses the FlyMine data, the data being on a local machine, or accessed via a FlyMine webservice.

itemizedlist.listitem: Issue the command ant jar (if building from source). This will create a file flymine.jar in the dist directory.
Copy the file flymine.jar to a directory on your classpath
Copy any of the jars in the lib/ directory that you don't already have to a directory on your classpath

Write a program using the FlyMine Query API. Many things (such as locations of the data) are configurable by having a file flymine.properties in your classpath (earlier than flymine.jar). An example flymine.properties can be found in the jar file.

sect2.title: Building a FlyMine database
sect2.para: A FlyMine database contains data in a certain format that has been integrated from various other data sources. These data sources must be installed locally and their locations configures in flymine.properties.

itemizedlist.listitem: Edit the file flymine.properties, changing the locations of servers and datasources to match your local site. This file is commented so should be self-explanatory.
Issue the command ant build-db to build the integrated database. This may take a very long time to complete, depending on the number of datasources configured.

sect2.title: Building a FlyMine web site
sect2.para: A FlyMine website is the front end to a FlyMine ObjectStore.

itemizedlist.listitem: Ensure you have an running Tomcat installation, including the manager application.
Configure the webserver properties in the build.properties file.
Configure the underlying ObjectStore properties in the flymine.properties file.

sect2.title: Building a FlyMine web service
sect2.para: A FlyMine webservice provides SOAP access to an underlying ObjectStore.

itemizedlist.listitem: Ensure you have an running Tomcat installation, including the manager application.
Configure the webserver properties in the build.properties file.
Configure the underlying ObjectStore properties in the flymine.properties file.
